31#ifndef _USER_ATOMIC_H_
32#define _USER_ATOMIC_H_
33
34/* __Userspace__ version of sys/i386/include/atomic.h goes here */
35
36/* TODO In the future, might want to not use i386 specific assembly.
37 * The options include:
38 * - implement them generically (but maybe not truly atomic?) in userspace
39 * - have ifdef's for __Userspace_arch_ perhaps (OS isn't enough...)
40 */
41
42#include <stdio.h>
43#include <sys/types.h>
44
45#if defined(__APPLE__) || defined(_WIN32)
46#if defined(_WIN32)
47#define atomic_add_int(addr, val) InterlockedExchangeAdd((LPLONG)addr, (LONG)val)
48#define atomic_fetchadd_int(addr, val) InterlockedExchangeAdd((LPLONG)addr, (LONG)val)
49#define atomic_subtract_int(addr, val) InterlockedExchangeAdd((LPLONG)addr,-((LONG)val))
50#define atomic_cmpset_int(dst, exp, src) InterlockedCompareExchange((LPLONG)dst, src, exp)
51#define SCTP_DECREMENT_AND_CHECK_REFCOUNT(addr) (InterlockedExchangeAdd((LPLONG)addr, (-1L)) == 1)
52#else
53#include <libkern/OSAtomic.h>
54#define atomic_add_int(addr, val) OSAtomicAdd32Barrier(val, (int32_t *)addr)
55#define atomic_fetchadd_int(addr, val) OSAtomicAdd32Barrier(val, (int32_t *)addr)
56#define atomic_subtract_int(addr, val) OSAtomicAdd32Barrier(-val, (int32_t *)addr)
57#define atomic_cmpset_int(dst, exp, src) OSAtomicCompareAndSwapIntBarrier(exp, src, (int *)dst)
58#define SCTP_DECREMENT_AND_CHECK_REFCOUNT(addr) (atomic_fetchadd_int(addr, -1) == 0)
59#endif
60
61#if defined(INVARIANTS)
62#define SCTP_SAVE_ATOMIC_DECREMENT(addr, val) \
63{ \
64 int32_t newval; \
65 newval = atomic_fetchadd_int(addr, -val); \
66 if (newval < 0) { \
67 panic("Counter goes negative"); \
68 } \
69}
70#else
71#define SCTP_SAVE_ATOMIC_DECREMENT(addr, val) \
72{ \
73 int32_t newval; \
74 newval = atomic_fetchadd_int(addr, -val); \
75 if (newval < 0) { \
76 *addr = 0; \
77 } \
78}
79#endif
80#if defined(_WIN32)
81static void atomic_init(void) {} /* empty when we are not using atomic_mtx */
82#else
83// WebKit change, this conflicts with atomic_init
84// static inline void atomic_init(void) {} /* empty when we are not using atomic_mtx */
85#endif
86
87#else
88/* Using gcc built-in functions for atomic memory operations
89 Reference: http://gcc.gnu.org/onlinedocs/gcc-4.1.0/gcc/Atomic-Builtins.html
90 Requires gcc version 4.1.0
91 compile with -march=i486
92 */
93
94/*Atomically add V to *P.*/
95#define atomic_add_int(P, V) (void) __sync_fetch_and_add(P, V)
96
97/*Atomically subtrace V from *P.*/
98#define atomic_subtract_int(P, V) (void) __sync_fetch_and_sub(P, V)
99
100/*
101 * Atomically add the value of v to the integer pointed to by p and return
102 * the previous value of *p.
103 */
104#define atomic_fetchadd_int(p, v) __sync_fetch_and_add(p, v)
105
106/* Following explanation from src/sys/i386/include/atomic.h,
107 * for atomic compare and set
108 *
109 * if (*dst == exp) *dst = src (all 32 bit words)
110 *
111 * Returns 0 on failure, non-zero on success
112 */
113
114#define atomic_cmpset_int(dst, exp, src) __sync_bool_compare_and_swap(dst, exp, src)
115
116#define SCTP_DECREMENT_AND_CHECK_REFCOUNT(addr) (atomic_fetchadd_int(addr, -1) == 1)
117#if defined(INVARIANTS)
118#define SCTP_SAVE_ATOMIC_DECREMENT(addr, val) \
119{ \
120 int32_t oldval; \
121 oldval = atomic_fetchadd_int(addr, -val); \
122 if (oldval < val) { \
123 panic("Counter goes negative"); \
124 } \
125}
126#else
127#define SCTP_SAVE_ATOMIC_DECREMENT(addr, val) \
128{ \
129 int32_t oldval; \
130 oldval = atomic_fetchadd_int(addr, -val); \
131 if (oldval < val) { \
132 *addr = 0; \
133 } \
134}
135#endif
136static inline void atomic_init(void) {} /* empty when we are not using atomic_mtx */
137#endif
138
139#if 0 /* using libatomic_ops */
140#include "user_include/atomic_ops.h"
141
142/*Atomically add incr to *P, and return the original value of *P.*/
143#define atomic_add_int(P, V) AO_fetch_and_add((AO_t*)P, V)
144
145#define atomic_subtract_int(P, V) AO_fetch_and_add((AO_t*)P, -(V))
146
147/*
148 * Atomically add the value of v to the integer pointed to by p and return
149 * the previous value of *p.
150 */
151#define atomic_fetchadd_int(p, v) AO_fetch_and_add((AO_t*)p, v)
152
153/* Atomically compare *addr to old_val, and replace *addr by new_val
154 if the first comparison succeeds. Returns nonzero if the comparison
155 succeeded and *addr was updated.
156*/
157/* Following Explanation from src/sys/i386/include/atomic.h, which
158 matches that of AO_compare_and_swap above.
159 * Atomic compare and set, used by the mutex functions
160 *
161 * if (*dst == exp) *dst = src (all 32 bit words)
162 *
163 * Returns 0 on failure, non-zero on success
164 */
165
166#define atomic_cmpset_int(dst, exp, src) AO_compare_and_swap((AO_t*)dst, exp, src)
167
168static inline void atomic_init() {} /* empty when we are not using atomic_mtx */
169#endif /* closing #if for libatomic */
170
171#if 0 /* using atomic_mtx */
172
173#include <pthread.h>
174
175extern userland_mutex_t atomic_mtx;
176
177#if defined(_WIN32)
178static inline void atomic_init() {
179 InitializeCriticalSection(&atomic_mtx);
180}
181static inline void atomic_destroy() {
182 DeleteCriticalSection(&atomic_mtx);
183}
184static inline void atomic_lock() {
185 EnterCriticalSection(&atomic_mtx);
186}
187static inline void atomic_unlock() {
188 LeaveCriticalSection(&atomic_mtx);
189}
190#else
191static inline void atomic_init() {
192 pthread_mutexattr_t mutex_attr;
193
194 pthread_mutexattr_init(&mutex_attr);
195#ifdef INVARIANTS
196 pthread_mutexattr_settype(&mutex_attr, PTHREAD_MUTEX_ERRORCHECK);
197#endif
198 pthread_mutex_init(&accept_mtx, &mutex_attr);
199 pthread_mutexattr_destroy(&mutex_attr);
200}
201static inline void atomic_destroy() {
202 (void)pthread_mutex_destroy(&atomic_mtx);
203}
204static inline void atomic_lock() {
205#ifdef INVARIANTS
206 KASSERT(pthread_mutex_lock(&atomic_mtx) == 0, ("atomic_lock: atomic_mtx already locked"))
207#else
208 (void)pthread_mutex_lock(&atomic_mtx);
209#endif
210}
211static inline void atomic_unlock() {
212#ifdef INVARIANTS
213 KASSERT(pthread_mutex_unlock(&atomic_mtx) == 0, ("atomic_unlock: atomic_mtx not locked"))
214#else
215 (void)pthread_mutex_unlock(&atomic_mtx);
216#endif
217}
218#endif
219/*
220 * For userland, always use lock prefixes so that the binaries will run
221 * on both SMP and !SMP systems.
222 */
223
224#define MPLOCKED "lock ; "
225
226/*
227 * Atomically add the value of v to the integer pointed to by p and return
228 * the previous value of *p.
229 */
230static __inline u_int
231atomic_fetchadd_int(volatile void *n, u_int v)
232{
233 int *p = (int *) n;
234 atomic_lock();
235 __asm __volatile(
236 " " MPLOCKED " "
237 " xaddl %0, %1 ; "
238 "# atomic_fetchadd_int"
239 : "+r" (v), /* 0 (result) */
240 "=m" (*p) /* 1 */
241 : "m" (*p)); /* 2 */
242 atomic_unlock();
243
244 return (v);
245}
246
247
248#ifdef CPU_DISABLE_CMPXCHG
249
250static __inline int
251atomic_cmpset_int(volatile u_int *dst, u_int exp, u_int src)
252{
253 u_char res;
254
255 atomic_lock();
256 __asm __volatile(
257 " pushfl ; "
258 " cli ; "
259 " cmpl %3,%4 ; "
260 " jne 1f ; "
261 " movl %2,%1 ; "
262 "1: "
263 " sete %0 ; "
264 " popfl ; "
265 "# atomic_cmpset_int"
266 : "=q" (res), /* 0 */
267 "=m" (*dst) /* 1 */
268 : "r" (src), /* 2 */
269 "r" (exp), /* 3 */
270 "m" (*dst) /* 4 */
271 : "memory");
272 atomic_unlock();
273
274 return (res);
275}
276
277#else /* !CPU_DISABLE_CMPXCHG */
278
279static __inline int
280atomic_cmpset_int(volatile u_int *dst, u_int exp, u_int src)
281{
282 atomic_lock();
283 u_char res;
284
285 __asm __volatile(
286 " " MPLOCKED " "
287 " cmpxchgl %2,%1 ; "
288 " sete %0 ; "
289 "1: "
290 "# atomic_cmpset_int"
291 : "=a" (res), /* 0 */
292 "=m" (*dst) /* 1 */
293 : "r" (src), /* 2 */
294 "a" (exp), /* 3 */
295 "m" (*dst) /* 4 */
296 : "memory");
297 atomic_unlock();
298
299 return (res);
300}
301
302#endif /* CPU_DISABLE_CMPXCHG */
303
304#define atomic_add_int(P, V) do { \
305 atomic_lock(); \
306 (*(u_int *)(P) += (V)); \
307 atomic_unlock(); \
308} while(0)
309#define atomic_subtract_int(P, V) do { \
310 atomic_lock(); \
311 (*(u_int *)(P) -= (V)); \
312 atomic_unlock(); \
313} while(0)
314
315#endif
316#endif
317
